title: Costume room

properties.name: description
properties.value: A Costume room is found in a player-owned house, and is used to store Treasure Trails rewards, random event items, some types of armour, capes and non-tradeable holiday items.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Costume room
For a list of all items and upgrades within the Construction skill, see Construction/Level up table.
Costume room
Released18 October 2006 (Update)
Icon
Construction level42
Cost50,000
Door layout
Costume room

A Costume room is found in a player-owned house, and is used to store Treasure Trails rewards, random event items, some types of armour, capes and non-tradeable holiday items.

The costume room requires level 42 Construction and 50,000 to build. If a bank PIN has been set, all furniture requires the PIN to be able to view, add, or remove items. Only the owner of the house may add or remove items from the costume room, though visitors may view the collections. Multiple instances of each item may be stored and retrieved from storage; however Ultimate Ironmen cannot store duplicate items, or withdraw items before first depositing the entire set an item belongs to. A costume room has one door, and one costume room may be built in a player-owned house.

The costume room cannot be removed unless all items in all pieces of furniture have been removed first. Furniture which store items can only be removed from the room if they are empty. Relocation of the costume room can be done using the House Viewer in the House Options interface.

Upgrading the furniture can be done two ways: raw materials and flatpacks.

There are 6 hotspots available:

  • Armour case space
  • Cape rack space
  • Fancy dress box space
  • Magic wardrobe space
  • Toy box space
  • Treasure chest space

Contents

  • 1 Armour case
  • 2 Cape rack
  • 3 Fancy dress box
  • 4 Magic wardrobe
  • 5 Toy box
  • 6 Treasure chest

Armour case[edit | edit source]

Armour cases can be used to store certain armours. A full list of items that can be stored in an armour case can be found at the armour case space article.

Level Armour case Materials Experience Upgrade Cost Total Cost Storage Limit
46 Oak armour case Oak plank x3 180 N/A 1,395 25 Armour Sets
64 Teak armour case Oak armour case
Teak plank x3 		270 2,565 3,960 50 Armour Sets
82 Mahogany armour case Teak armour case
Mahogany plank x3 		420 6,408 10,368 Infinite Armour Sets

Cape rack[edit | edit source]

Cape racks can be used to hang various capes, including Capes of Accomplishment (both the cape and hood must be hung on the rack). A list of the capes that can be stored is available at the cape rack space article.

Level Cape rack Materials Experience Upgrade Cost Total Cost Storage Limit
54 Oak cape rack Oak plank x4 240 N/A 1,860 All capes, except Capes of Accomplishment
63 Teak cape rack Oak cape rack
Teak plank x4 		360 3,420 5,280 All capes, plus one Cape of Accomplishment
72 Mahogany cape rack Teak cape rack
Mahogany plank x4 		560 8,544 13,824 All capes, plus five Capes of Accomplishment
81 Gilded cape rack Mahogany cape rack
Mahogany plank x4
Gold leaf 		860 144,637 158,461 All capes, plus ten Capes of Accomplishment
90 Marble cape rack Gilded cape rack
Marble block 		500 332,156 490,617 All capes
99 Magical cape rack Marble cape rack
Magic stone 		1,000 994,511 1,485,128 All capes

Fancy dress box[edit | edit source]

Fancy dress boxes are used to store various cosmetic outfits from certain random events. Random event sets are obtained by completing the random events several times. A list of the fancy dresses that can be stored is available at the fancy dress box space article.

Level Fancy dress box Materials Experience Upgrade Cost Total Cost Storage Limit
44 Oak fancy dress box Oak plank x2 120 N/A 930 Stores 2 types of costumes
62 Teak fancy dress box Oak fancy dress box
Teak plank x2 		180 1,710 2,640 Stores 4 types of costumes
80 Mahogany fancy dress box Teak fancy dress box
Mahogany plank x2 		280 4,272 6,912 Stores all types of costumes

Magic wardrobe[edit | edit source]

Magic wardrobes can be used to store certain magic armours. A list of the magic armours that can be stored is available at the magic wardrobe space article.

Level Magic wardrobe Materials Experience Upgrade Cost Total Cost Storage Limit
42 Oak magic wardrobe Oak plank x4 240 N/A 1,860 7 Mage Sets
51 Carved oak magic wardrobe Oak magic wardrobe
Oak plank x6 		360 2,790 4,650 14 Mage Sets
60 Teak magic wardrobe Carved oak magic wardrobe
Teak plank x4 		360 3,420 8,070 21 Mage Sets
69 Carved teak magic wardrobe Teak magic wardrobe
Teak plank x6 		540 5,130 13,200 28 Mage Sets
78 Mahogany magic wardrobe Carved teak magic wardrobe
Mahogany plank x4 		560 8,544 21,744 35 Mage Sets
87 Gilded magic wardrobe Mahogany magic wardrobe
Mahogany plank x4
Gold leaf 		860 144,637 166,381 42 Mage Sets
96 Marble magic wardrobe Gilded magic wardrobe
Marble block 		500 332,156 498,537 Infinite Mage Sets

Toy box[edit | edit source]

Toy boxes are used to store Holiday rewards. These are usually obtained during festivities such as Christmas, Easter and Halloween. However, certain tradeable items such as partyhats cannot be stored in these toy boxes. A list of the toys that can be stored is available at the toy box space article.

There is no known distinction between the toy boxes; all toys can be stored in any of the boxes.

It should be noted that not all untradeable holiday items can be stored. Specifically, the Event rpg from 2014 cannot be stored in the toy box. However players can purchase one from Diango should they lose it, or do not wish to store it anywhere.

Level Toy box Materials Experience Cost
50 Oak toy box Oak plank x2 120 930
68 Teak toy box Teak plank x2 180 1,710
86 Mahogany toy box Mahogany plank x2 280 4,272

Treasure chest[edit | edit source]

Treasure chests are used to store Treasure Trails rewards, either bought or discovered by players themselves.

A full list of items that can be stored in a treasure chest can be found at the treasure chest space article.

Level Treasure chest Materials Experience Upgrade Cost Total Cost Storage Limit
48 Oak treasure chest Oak plank x2 120 N/A 930 Store beginner and easy Treasure Trails rewards
66 Teak treasure chest Oak treasure chest
Teak plank x2 		180 1,710 2,640 Store beginner, easy and medium Treasure Trails rewards
84 Mahogany treasure chest Teak treasure chest
Mahogany plank x2 		280 4,272 6,912 Store all levels of Treasure Trails rewards
